alert.note: Alert for Iron; Madison; Reynolds (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 30 at 1:19PM CST until January 31 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and sleet expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations around one inch expected. Locally higher amounts are possible. * WHERE...Iron MO, Madison MO, and Reynolds MO Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: The rapid accumulation of snow and sleet will make travel extremely difficult, if not impossible at times. If travel is necessary, be sure to exercise extreme caution. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained at traveler.modot.org/map or by calling 1-888-275-6636. It only takes a small amount of sleet to make roads, bridges, sidewalks and parking lots icy and dangerous. Plan for a slow trip and use caution when approaching turns, bridges and overpasses. Remain alert for rapid changes in road conditions. Those planning travel should be advised that visibilities will vary greatly across the area, and weather conditions in rural areas will be much worse than those in a nearby town or city. Do not be fooled, if you are planning travel in an open area, make certain you and your car are prepared for the elements. Although treated roads may just be wet, untreated surfaces will be ice covered and very slippery. Motorists should remain alert for rapid changes in road conditions, especially when turning onto lesser travelled roads, side streets, or parking lots.
